Intro

aphla is a python library for accelerator physics commissioning and experiments developed at NSLS-II, BNL. It takes advantages of NSLS-II service oriented architecture, e.g. channel finder service, model service and unit conversion service, to become a package more than equipment control. aphla could be used for other facilities.

A simple example which read the current orbit and show the plot

>>> import aphla as ap
>>> ap.machines.init("nsls2v2")
>>> ap.getOrbit(spos=True)

For the power user, you have full control of each PV

Get Started

  • Quick start for NSLS-II.
  • Tutorial has more details for the installation and settings
  • Code examples are always helpful for impatient people like me.
  • Get help with the Python built-in functions: help([object]) and dir([object])
